intro: Peucedanum harmsianum subsp. australe, commonly known as the Australian cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces umbrella-shaped clusters of flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
